intro: Bauerella simplicifolia subsp. petiolaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bauerella, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in coastal or subalpine regions. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, with reddish-brown bark and evergreen foliage. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated petioles, which give it its specific epithet.
